intro: Deverra triradiata subsp. intermedia, commonly known as the yellow bellflower, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It is characterized by its yellow, bell-shaped flowers that bloom in late summer. The plant has a woody stem and lance-shaped leaves with a rough texture. It thrives in well-drained soils and full sun, making it suitable for rock gardens and coastal areas. Its ornamental value is enhanced by its vibrant color and unique floral structure.
